OriginalSource.Creator: Edward Cowen, MD, MHSc
Robert Pilarski, MS, LGC, LSW, The Ohio State University

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Two-panel photograph showing the tongues of two individuals with Cowden syndrome. The left panel shows a tongue covered with many small white bumps. The right panel shows a tongue with larger, irregularly shaped growths on its surface.

Captions.MediaCaption: Oral papillomas are benign growths of epithelial cells that may be seen in individuals with Cowden syndrome, a hereditary syndrome associated with the development of several types of cancer. The papillomas may vary in size.

ProposedUse.Summary: PTEN hamartoma tumor syndromes (including Cowden syndrome) - Introduction [Module];Genetics;Health professionals

ProcessingStatus.Comment: Please translate only the Content Description and Caption (image has no labels)
